description: From Middle English starkli, starcliche, sterkliche, stercliche, from Old English stearclīċe (“strongly; stoutly; vigorously; vehemently; fiercely; strictly”), from Proto-Germanic *starkulīka (“strongly; stiffly”), from *starkulīkaz (“strong; rigid”), from *starkuz (“strong; stiff; stark”), equivalent to stark +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: starkly (comparative more starkly, superlative most starkly)

entries.meaning: In a stark manner; with great contrast.
examples: The dark mountains stood out starkly against the pale sky.
